ud5.3:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ud5.3:1.3: At that time in Rājagaha there was a leper called Suppabuddha.
ud5.3:1.4: He was poor, destitute, and pitiful.
ud5.3:1.5: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
ud5.3:2.1: Suppabuddha saw the crowd seated off in the distance
ud5.3:2.3: “Surely some different foods will be distributed there.
ud5.3:2.4: Why don’t I approach the crowd?
ud5.3:2.5: Hopefully I’ll get something to eat.”
ud5.3:3.2: where he saw the Buddha teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
ud5.3:3.3: When he saw this he thought,
ud5.3:3.4: “No different foods will be distributed there.
